results.title: Cat's cradle
results.creator_credit: Luigi Acquisto, Chris McGill, Liz Hughes, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Film Victoria
results.brief_description:
The Father lies stiff and near-naked on the kitchen table. His family prepare his body for an outing to the cinema and then carry him through a bleak landscape of concrete roads and decaying factories. This short film combines highly expressionist black and white cinematography with an ominous atmospheric soundtrack. The result is a bizarre and perverse film that has the texture of a dream. Winner of multiple awards for Best Short Film, including prizes at the Melbourne, Edinburgh and London Film Festivals.
Cast includes Helen Rollinson, Ian Nash, Imogen Gough, Paul Bajada, Ryan Giddins and features William McInnes as an extra.

results.title: Casuarina Equisetifolia
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which look at various species of native trees growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. This film is about a species of pine tree called Casuarina Equisetifolia. Groves of these graceful trees grow on the rocky slopes above the ocean where cicadas hum in their branches and the long clusters of Casuarina needles shimmer silver and black in the breeze. The film follows the development of the small cones. The song of the small brown Honey-eater is heard on the sound track mixed in with the sound of a solo flute. Music performed by Nancy Tow.

results.title: Casualties of war
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Art Linson and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Hailed by critics as a masterpice, this film is based on the true story of a squad of U.S. soldiers caught in the moral dilemma of wartime Vietnam. Witness to a vile crime, Private Ericksson (Michael J. Fox) is forced to stand alone against his fellow soldiers and commanding officer Sergeant Meserve (Sean Penn), a powerful and charismatic man pushed over the edge of barbarism by the terror and brutality of combat. With sweeping scope, action and raw power, master filmmaker, Brian De Palma creates a devastating and unforgettable tale of one man’s quest for sanity and justice amidst the chaos of war. Based upon the book by Daniel Lang.

results.title: Casual menace
results.brief_description: Sleeping rough in bus shelters and roadside ditches from Darwin to Dubbo, the artists collect a large image-gallery of characters, landscapes, abstractions and moods. Using video and Super 8, they explore the alienating environments of the road and the lonesome souls who travel through these spaces and times. A dark meditation on the nomadic spaces of rural Australia, Casual Menace is composed of two interrelated video loops The Chance Map and Moths. Using the footage gathered from their numerous hitchhiking ‘experiments’, the artists explore the fragile, lonely spaces of remote highways.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a-part series. Explains the facilities available for medical examination and, if necessary, treatment of people who think they may have been exposed to sexually transmitted diseases.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part series. Provides basic factual information about infectious diseases which are transmitted by sexual contact. Stresses the importance of seeking proper medical examination and, if necessary, treatment.

results.title: Castro's Cuba
results.creator_credit: Independent Television News (GB), Chris Sheridan and Keith Lambourne
results.brief_description: Cuba has been embargoed by the USA, abandoned by Russia, is one of the remaining issues of the Cold War and is close to bankruptcy, but the citizens of the country still fervently support their leader Fidel Castro. This documentary tells the story of Castro’s rise to power, the revolution of 1959, his reform programmes and his program of relations with the world’s superpowers as well as regional neighbours. It also investigates why this charismatic man is so adored by his citizens and how he has maintained his ‘beloved’ status for so long.

results.title: Castor and Pollux: a tale of two spiritual brothers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Phil Noyce and Tom Manefield
results.brief_description: A sometimes humorous, sometimes serious examination of the lifestyles of two middle-aged men in a revolt against conventional living. One is a bikie and the other a hippy.

results.title: Castlevania: Symphony of the Night
results.brief_description: Dracula’s castle has risen again and it’s up to the mysterious Alucard to face Dracula and save the world. Though not considered successful at release, it’s become the blueprint for successive games in the series.

constellations_other.name: Shadowplay and spookiness
constellations_other.description: Silhouettes and shadows scare up some of the most sinister creatures in cinema and videogames.

results.description:
Castlevania: Symphony of the Night begins during the ending of the previous game in the series, Castlevania: Rondo of Blood, where Richter Belmont (Michael G.; David Vincent in the redub) confronts and defeats Count Dracula (Scott McCulloch; Patrick Seitz in the redub). Four years later, in 1796, Alucard (Robert Belgrade; Yuri Lowenthal in the redub) arrives at the castle. Inside, he meets Dracula’s servant Death (Dennis Falt; Travis Willingham in the redub), who warns him to stop his quest to destroy the castle and strips him of his equipment. He also meets Maria Renard (Kimberly Forsythe; Michelle Ruff in the redub), a seventeen-year-old vampire hunter who fought alongside Richter and is now searching for him, and the castle’s librarian, who sells items and equipment to Alucard. Periodically encountering Maria throughout the castle, Alucard also meets Richter, who claims to be the new lord of the castle and forces him to battle with two monsters.

Alucard defeats the monsters, finds Maria again, and tells her about Richter. Upset, she leaves Alucard to confirm it for herself. Convinced that Richter is under somebody else’s control, Maria meets Alucard again; she urges him not to hurt Richter and gives him an item that allows him to see past illusions. In the castle’s keep, Alucard confronts Richter and learns that he plans to resurrect Dracula so he may battle the vampire for eternity. Alucard breaks the spell controlling Richter. Dracula’s servant Shaft (Jeff Manning; Tony Oliver in the redub) appears and reveals that despite the spell being broken, Dracula will be resurrected soon. Shaft summons an inverted version of the castle.

Alucard leaves Richter to Maria’s care and enters the inverted castle to find and destroy Shaft. Along the way, he defeats Death and eventually finds Shaft. Shaft admits he planned to end the threat of the Belmont clan by controlling one as the master of the castle and forcing them to fight each other. Alucard defeats Shaft, who reveals that Dracula’s resurrection is complete. Alucard faces his own father, who vows to destroy humankind because Alucard’s mother Lisa was executed as a witch. Alucard refuses to join his father in his revenge and the two battle. Alucard defeats his father and suggests he lost the battle because he lost his ability to love after Lisa’s death. Dracula quotes the biblical verse Matthew 16:26 (in the dub) and learns that Lisa’s final words were of eternal love for him and a plea not to hate – or at least harm – humanity.

As Dracula vanishes, he asks for Lisa’s forgiveness and bids his son farewell. Escaping the crumbling castle, Alucard rejoins Maria and Richter. Maria expresses relief that he escaped while Richter blames himself as the reason for Alucard’s fight with his father. Alucard tells Richter, “the only thing necessary for evil to triumph is for good men to do nothing,” (an attributed quote from Edmund Burke) and resolves to disappear from the world because of his cursed bloodline. Depending on how much of the castle the player has explored, Maria either chases Alucard in the hope of changing his mind, or resigns herself to Alucard’s fate and leaves with Richter.
